subject: AI & Agents
title: Zero-Shot Prompting
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Zero-Shot Prompting.

hook.text: You ask the model to classify sentiment with zero examples‚Äîand it nails it.

buildup.text: Zero-shot means giving only an instruction, no examples at all.

discovery.text: It works because large models have seen similar tasks during pre-training.

twist.text: Zero-shot fails on niche or ambiguous tasks where the model guesses wrong.

climax.text: Start zero-shot. If accuracy is low, add examples‚Äîthat's few-shot.

quiz.question: What defines zero-shot prompting?
options: Giving only an instruction with no examples
